intro: Justicia salvioides, commonly known as the purple crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet. The plant features showy, purple to pink flowers that bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
